website_summaries.verdict: The best budget hybrid children’s bike that does not sacrifice quality and adjustability for the price.
pros: 24-inch wheels offer plenty of maneuverability and performance on hard and loose surfaces
Gears are easy to shift when pedaling under load or going uphill
Most of the parts are replaceable or upgradable
cons: Bike lacks durable drivetrain parts and may require replacing after some heavy riding

customer_reviews.title: New update since purchased.
customer_reviews.text: I’m an older man (53), and this is such a quality bike. I bought two of these bikes, 6 weeeks ago. I had a few problems with my bike, (shipping damage), but it was cosmetic. After contacting Diamondback customer service, they were able to help me resolve the minor problems that occurred. Me and my wife enjoy these bikes quite a bit, and for us these are the best bikes we ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Ogden Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: Received the bike 3 days before it was scheduled to be there! Never put a bike together before, but it was fairly simple. It takes a little bit to get the brakes adjusted but not bad at all. Bike looks great and is comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Nimble, ultra-light aluminum bike with internal cable routing ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the wheels with Mavic Open Elite's and put on some low resistance tires, some 9 inch hi-rise handle bars, better grips. You can sling the bike around and throw it over your shoulder with minimal effort. Handling is just really good. This is a special bike that this company is selling for 1/2 of what they sold it for 2 years ago. So I am getting a second one ... Call me a sucker for good quality. jb
customer_reviews.author: John C. Bendheim, M.D.Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Not a safe bike.
customer_reviews.text: This does what I bought it to do. Quick trips to the store or park, but I wouldn't recommend. It's simply too big. I'm 6 ft and it's a pain to get on and off of this thing. I purchased the large frame. It doesn't climb small hills very well and the traction on the tires forces me to make very wide turns. The chain also comes off very easy. The brakes are cheap and you need plenty of space to stop. I've had many bikes and wanted something inexpensive - I should have just spent more.
customer_reviews.author: mikenphx34

customer_reviews.title: Faulty from day one
customer_reviews.text: the chain won't stay on the largest chainring no matter what I do, and the cranks make a creaking sound that gets louder with every ride. to the point that I worry I'm damaging the bike by riding it, and this only gets worse every day. I can not replace this bike as Amazon does not have it available anymore. I've submitted a warranty claim because I refuse to spend any more money on a bike that was guaranteed to be ready to ride out of the box. Lets see if Diamondback makes good on their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: I Trocco

customer_reviews.title: Great product for value, some instructions not included
customer_reviews.text: Great except some of the instructions are for assembly has already been completed, while some of the assembly has no instructions. Great except some of the instructions are for assembly that’s already been completed, while some of the assembly has no instructions
customer_reviews.author: Fredrick Scott Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bike. Didn’t know it came with the brake pads oriented wrong until I delivered it to my college student, away from the tools needed to adjust them. Otherwise, perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Todd P. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these. Big Mistake. One has a warped front tire. The other was missing so many parts that I will have to return it. Missing seat, pedals, seat clamp, screw for front wheel and probably missing more. That's when I gave up.
customer_reviews.author: White

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive bike
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly decent for such a cheap bike. I am happy with the purchase. I have crashed a couple of times, so I cannot comment on bike's endurability as its problems are mostly my fault. At under 300 bucks, though, it was well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to put together. Position of riding is what I needed for back and neck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great value for the money and comfortable too!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together if you follow the directions. it's a bit weird having to juggle through the manual which is designed for multiple bicycles, but once I got the hang of it setup was a breeze. Ride and shifting is smooth, paint is good too. top speed so far was 28mph and still very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Benedict Pedro

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful, comfortable, easy to ride bike & I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its pretty nice.
customer_reviews.text: Its pretty nice.. one of the the front inner tube was messed up but other than that pretty nice bike
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: Great bike, husband loves it. He took his time to put it together watching youtube video. My only disappointment was that it had scratches but the box was fine when it was delivered
customer_reviews.author: Natalya Mahr

customer_reviews.title: Good looking bike with issues
customer_reviews.text: Very attractive bike, however, after less than two weeks of riding, it looks like I'm going to have to replace the front brakes and seat as the front brakes have rapidly deteriorated and the seat bolts come loose after short rides and seem to be permanently warped. Disappointed that some parts are so shoddy when the bike overall seems very solid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great all around bike. Handles fine and is very comfortable. Although the first one came in with a defective wheel and it had to be sent back the vendor was easy to work with and I was totally satisfied with the second. Easy assembly with all the tools provided. I’m 6’0” and the 19” large model fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Ditchman

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bike and easy to assemble. The ride is very smooth. Worth the price. Quite pleased!
customer_reviews.author: EC in NY

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike! The assembly wasn't too bad...but takes a person paying attention to directions.
customer_reviews.author: JAandFam

customer_reviews.title: Fake front shock - quickly returned
customer_reviews.text: I could not believe they did put a fake front shock on this bike. My son was totally disappointed and we quickly returned it. Please Diamondback start making some real bikes!!
customer_reviews.author: CDG

customer_reviews.title: it looks and feels like a high end bike
customer_reviews.text: Mine came poorly packaged, lots of cosmetic damage and back tire tube popped during first ride.... Changed the bad tube that came with the bike and didnt make it a whole day before the shifter decided to break.
customer_reviews.author: Product Inspector

customer_reviews.title: No assembly instructions, but great bike!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is a beast to put together. The provided instructions are for a different bike and are of no help whatsoever. Same with the online assembly videos, they don't have any instructions specific to this bicycle that I could find. Be prepared to spend quite a while figuring out how to put it all together and get everything tuned properly. Once that is all done its a fantastic bike!
customer_reviews.author: A. Ingram

customer_reviews.title: very good buy fine bicycle
customer_reviews.text: It was $100 less than normal, I have been very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: James Massey

customer_reviews.title: I could have used a 17-18 but I absolutely LOVE the bike
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 19" and I am 5-9. I could have used a 17-18 but I absolutely LOVE the bike!
customer_reviews.author: Florida Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Great casual bike
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bike for casual rides honestly. Easy to put together with some youtube videos or just any prior knowledge (you just need to put the handlebar on, attach the front wheel, and adjust the front brakes). The materials are all quite sturdy, as this is Diamondback. So far my only issue is that the chain kind of grates a bit in certain gears (just makes a noise, no actual performance problems) but I think it may be because of how many speeds there are.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bike, it is worth every cent. Good price, good product. I commute to work every day, good quality bike for a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great bike at a good price
customer_reviews.text: My 17 year old loves this bike. It was easy to put together and rides well. We've had it three months and he is really pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hohn

customer_reviews.title: Good everyday buke
customer_reviews.text: Great bike, good ride, easy shift. A little difficult to assemble and adjust
customer_reviews.author: Jimofct

customer_reviews.title: Good solid bike.
customer_reviews.text: Instruction could be a little better. I googled YouTube for demo and clarification on a couple of thinks. Other than that, I like the bike, comfort and easy to adjust to fit me.
customer_reviews.author: family tech buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike to ride
customer_reviews.text: Great bike to ride ... the Large is actually taller than I thought it would be .. I'm 5' 10" and could have gotten a a medium. Assembly was pretty straight forward ... gears all work, but might still take to the bike shop to get it nice and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Miller

customer_reviews.title: with a good gear ratio for my
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected, with a good gear ratio for my terrain
customer_reviews.author: annie freymuth

customer_reviews.title: This bike is a beautiful thing. It rides so smooth and it is ...
customer_reviews.text: This bike is a beautiful thing. It rides so smooth and it is very comfortable to ride and sit on. I'll be honest and say that the instructions are confusing and difficult to follow at times, but I did my best to put it together. I did have to go to a bike shop for them to make sure all the parts were properly added and bolts were tightened
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Cordero

customer_reviews.title: These bikes are true to size!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my 6'5" 300 lb. son, hoping it would be big enough for him. We put it together (super easy, especially considering neither one of us had built a bike before!) and it is perfect. I bought a larger seat, assuming the stock one would be too small. I ended up returning it because the seat included is the perfect size. The blue isn't as girly as I thought it would be, which is awesome since he is 17 and opposed to anything girly. He says it is comfortable and easy to ride. All in all we couldn't be happier with this bike!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Bike arrived with rear wheel warped!
customer_reviews.text: After unpacking and assembly of Diamondback Edgewood Hybird Bike the the rear wheel was warped. Rather than go through disassembly and re-packaging, I will have to pay to get wheel trued.-Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Irvin

customer_reviews.title: Assembly issues
customer_reviews.text: Comes unassembled. Plan to pay at least $80 to have the bike assembled correctly. I'm fairly savy with bikes and was able to attach and adjust the brakes, but the bike came with severe derailer misalignment, loose brake lines and untrue wheels. Also feels like a women's bike
customer_reviews.author: norcal*buyer

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy the ride!
customer_reviews.text: My Edgewood provides the perfect blend of a comfortable riding position and easy-rolling performance. The larger wheel diameter contributes to an easier ride. The gear derailers and shifters work very well together. A bit on the heavy side, it’s still a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: things started falling apart from day one, contacted customer services, they were rude and of no help, back tire is warped and pedals had bad threading.
customer_reviews.author: Atomic

product_meta.title: Diamondback Bicycles Edgewood Hybrid Bike
product_meta.description: The Edgewood combines the same relaxed contact points and geometry of a comfort bike with the smooth-rolling 700C wheels of a road bike. The aluminum alloy frame is dependable and features classic geometry for a predictable and stable ride. The suspension fork and seat post add an extra layer of cushioning, and the 21-speed drivetrain gives you plenty of gears to get you through any terrain. An adjustable stem helps you dial in your preferences even further. With plenty of traction from wide tires and hassle-free brakes, it really is as simple as getting on and pedaling. With a ton of utility for the price, it's not hard to see why the Edgewood is a favorite.
feature_bullets: Aluminum frame with sport hybrid geometry for more upright pedaling position is built to last
Suspension fork and seatpost for added cushioning on bumps in the road
Shimano 21-speed drivetrain gives wide range of gears for any terrain
700C road wheels are efficient and smooth rolling
